string-array.name: sayings
string-array.item:
"Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm.
- Winston Churchill"

"Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
- Thomas Edison"

"\"Never Play With The Feelings Of Others Because You May Win The Game But The Risk Is That You Will Surely Lose The Person For A Life Time\".
- William Shakespeare"

"Opportunities Are Like Sunrises, If You Wait Too Long You Can Miss Them.
- William Arthur"

"Laughing Faces Do Not Mean That There Is Absence Of Sorrow! But It Means That They Have The Ability To Deal With It.
- William Shakespeare"

"The world is full of suffering but it is also full of people overcoming it.
- Helen Adams Keller"

"If you would win a man to your cause, first convince him that you are his sincere friend.
- Abraham Lincoln"

"It is no use saying, \"We are doing our best.\" You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
- Winston Churchill"

"A good plan, violently executed now, is better than a perfect plan next week.
- George Smith Patton Jr."

"God doesn't require us to succeed; he only requires that you try.
- Mother Teresa"

"You may delay,
but time will not.
- Benjamin Franklin"

"Dream as if you'll live forever. Live as if you'll die today.
- James Byron Dean"

"I'm convinced that the only thing that kept me going was that I loved what I did.
- Steve Jobs"

"Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
- Albert Einstein"

"Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
- Mahatma Gandhi"
"Think like a man of action and act like man of thought."
"Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises."
"Error is the discipline through which we advance."
"Nature never deceives us; it is always we who deceive ourselves."
"Books are ships which pass through the vast seas of time."
"The world is a beautiful book, but of little use to him who cannot read it."
"To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved."
"You will never know until you try."
"To climb steep hills requires slow pace at first."
"If you do not walk today, you will have to run tomorrow."
"If the wind will not serve, take to the oars."
"He is greatest who is most often in men's good thoughts."
"In the morning of life, work; in the midday, give counsel; in the evening, pray."
"Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value."
"Happiness and misery are not fated but self-sought."
"Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others."
"The regret after not doing something is bigger than that of doing something."
"Have fun this time, because it will never come again."
"Effort is the best way to realizing your dreams."
"Today, which was proved to be fruitless, is the day that the dead in the past was longing for."
"Luck is when preparedness meets opportunity."
"There is no best choice, but only a choice not to regret."
"Today is the first day of the rest of your life."
"For what is the best choice, for each individual is the highest it is possible for him to achieve."
"'Trial and error' is a ladder that reaching for the truth."
"Only the man who can kiss one's dream will come true that."
"Whenever you faced a big trouble, think about someone's sight always!"
"There isn't a person anywhere that isn't capable of doing more than he think he can."
"All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers."
"Winners have simply formed the habit of doing things losers don't like to do."
"Impossible is the excuse who do not try hard enough."
"A man is twice miserable when he fears his misery before it comes."
"Laugh and the world laugh with you; weep, and you weep alone."
"Time flies like an arrow and time lost never returns."
"Nothing costs so much as what is given to us."
"God gives every bird his worm, but he does not throw it into the nest."
"The grass is always greener on the other side."
"In good fortune, prudence; in ill fortune, patience."
"Good and evil are chiefly in the imagination."
"Be not the first to quarrel nor the last to make it up."
"Riches serve a wise man, and govern a fool."
"Don't throw away the old shoes till you've got new ones."
